content: 1 The elder unto Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truth.
content_old: 1 The elder unto Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truth.

content: 2 Beloved! concerning all things I pray thou mayest be prospering､ and be in health, even as thy soul is prospering.
content_old: 2 Beloved! concerning all things I pray thou mayest be prospering､ and be in health, even as thy soul is prospering.

content: 3 For I rejoiced exceedingly､ at brethren coming and bearing witness unto thy truth,—even as thou in truth art walking.
content_old: 3 For I rejoiced exceedingly､ at brethren coming and bearing witness unto thy truth,—even as thou in truth art walking.

content: 4 I have no greater favour than these things, that I should be hearing that my own children in the truth are walking.
content_old: 4 I have no greater favour than these things, that I should be hearing that my own children in the truth are walking.

content: 5 Beloved! a faithful thing art thou doing, whatsoever thou shalt accomplish for them that are brethren and withal strangers,—
content_old: 5 Beloved! a faithful thing art thou doing, whatsoever thou shalt accomplish for them that are brethren and withal strangers,—

content: 6 who have borne witness to thy love before the assembly: whom thou wilt do nobly to set forward worthily of God.
content_old: 6 who have borne witness to thy love before the assembly: whom thou wilt do nobly to set forward worthily of God.

content: 7 For in behalf of The Name have they gone forth, taking nothing from them of the nations.
content_old: 7 For in behalf of The Name have they gone forth, taking nothing from them of the nations.

content: 8 We therefore ought to be sustaining such as these, that we may become fellow workers with the truth.
content_old: 8 We therefore ought to be sustaining such as these, that we may become fellow workers with the truth.

content: 9 I wrote something unto the assembly; but he who is fond of taking the flest place among them—Diotrephes doth not make us welcome.
content_old: 9 I wrote something unto the assembly; but he who is fond of taking the flest place among them—Diotrephes doth not make us welcome.

content: 10 For this cause if I come I will bring to remembrance his works which he is doing,—with wicked words prating against us; and not content with these he neither himself maketh the brethren welcome, but them who are minded to do it he forbiddeth, and out of the assembly doth cast them.
content_old: 10 For this cause if I come I will bring to remembrance his works which he is doing,—with wicked words prating against us; and not content with these he neither himself maketh the brethren welcome, but them who are minded to do it he forbiddeth, and out of the assembly doth cast them.

content: 11 Beloved! be not thou imitating what is bad, but what is good. He that doeth good is of God: he that doeth what is bad hath not seen God.
content_old: 11 Beloved! be not thou imitating what is bad, but what is good. He that doeth good is of God: he that doeth what is bad hath not seen God.

content: 12 Unto Demetrius hath witness been borne by all and by the truth itself; howbeit we also bear witness, and thou knowest that our witness is true.
content_old: 12 Unto Demetrius hath witness been borne by all and by the truth itself; howbeit we also bear witness, and thou knowest that our witness is true.

content: 13 Many things had I to write unto thee,—but I am unwilling with ink and pen to be writing;
content_old: 13 Many things had I to write unto thee,—but I am unwilling with ink and pen to be writing;

content: 14 I hope､ however､ straightway to see thee, and mouth to mouth will we talk.
content_old: 14 I hope､ however､ straightway to see thee, and mouth to mouth will we talk.
